message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study uses data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and UNIDO's Industrial Statistics Database to analyze the technological capabilities of firms in Sub-Saharan African countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "UNIDO's Industrial Statistics Database"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Extractive Industries"]}, {"sentence": "We conducted a regression analysis using data on regional water quality from the Global Water Quality Database, controlling for climate patterns provided by CMIP5 data.", "dataset": ["Global Water Quality Database", "CMIP5"], "topic": ["Water", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis is based on household expenditure data from the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA) and rainfall data from the Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station Data (CHIRPS).", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)", "Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station Data (CHIRPS)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use a panel dataset covering 50 US states over the period 1997-2015 from the National Bureau of Economic Research's State Business Tax Climate Index, supplemented with data on state demographics, to examine the impact of state tax policy on economic growth.", "dataset": ["National Bureau of Economic Research's State Business Tax Climate Index"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Using panel data from the Central Bank of Kenya's Credit Reference Bureaus, we investigate how access to credit varies across different demographic groups in Kenya.", "dataset": ["Central Bank of Kenya's Credit Reference Bureaus"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from the World Development Indicators and the UN Comtrade database to assess the impact of trade openness on economic growth for a sample of 120 low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "UN Comtrade"], "topic": ["Trade", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We use household survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys to estimate the prevalence of malnutrition in children under the age of five in South Asian countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the determinants of CO2 emissions in Latin America, using panel data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and climate change projections from the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC).", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC)"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Our study draws on data from two sources: the Tanzania Data Lab's GeoPoll platform and the National Bureau of Statistics Tanzania for the period 2016-2020, to investigate the relationship between agricultural productivity and mobile phone technology adoption in Tanzania.", "dataset": ["Tanzania Data Lab's GeoPoll platform", "National Bureau of Statistics Tanzania"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "Using a rich dataset on public procurement contracts in Ukraine, we find that gender quotas in public procurement have a positive and significant impact on the number of women-owned firms that win contracts.", "dataset": ["public procurement contracts in Ukraine"], "topic": ["Gender"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "This study uses data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and UNIDO's Industrial Statistics Database to analyze the technological capabilities of firms in Sub-Saharan African countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "UNIDO's Industrial Statistics Database"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Extractive Industries"]}, {"sentence": "We conducted a regression
